meanings.definition: To overlook or forgive an offense
meanings.sent1: I cannot condone your actions of skipping class.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to condone dishonest behavior.
meanings.sent3: The teacher could not condone the student's excuse of a dog eating their homework.
meanings.sent4: She could not condone the blatant disregard for rules.
meanings.sent5: The judge's decision to condone the crime shocked the community.

meanings.definition: To approve or support something that is considered wrong or immoral
meanings.sent1: I will not condone cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to condone such behavior.
meanings.sent3: The parents could not condone their child's prank of putting salt in the sugar bowl.
meanings.sent4: She refused to condone the illegal activities of the group.
meanings.sent5: The company's decision to condone child labor sparked outrage.
